article:
Mr. Perkin stood at the bus stop and watched the cars go by. Many of the cars were new Beta 400s, and most of them were yellow. Mr. Perkin always _ the same clothes as other men, ate the same _ as other people, and did the same things after work. And _ the end of the week, Mr. Perkin did not like to be different.
The following week, Mr. Perkin bought a new, bright, yellow Beta 400s. He was very pleased with it, and _ to work just the next day. He was even more pleased with his new car, when he saw all the other Beta 400s,in front, behind, and on _ sides of it.
Mr. Perkin parked his car in a big parking near his office, and walked the _ of the way. But when he came back at five o'clock, there were _ many bright yellow Betas 400s in this parking. Mr. Perkin did not know which car was his. He tried his _ in some of the cars, but people passing by _ him a look that he did not like. So he stopped.
 _ Mr. Perkin had to wait for nearly two hours until other yellow Beta 400s left.
